item.title: Muntinlupa orders liquor ban during COVID-19 community quarantine
item.description: The local government of Muntinlupa has ordered the implementation of a liquor ban during all levels of community quarantine in the area.

item.title: August 10 start of Avigan trials in Philippines not yet final, DOH clarifies
item.description: The Department of Health (DOH) on Friday noon clarified that the August 10 start of clinical trials in the Philippines of the Japanese anti-viral flu drug Avigan is not yet final, saying legal documents have yet to be finalized.

item.title: Locsin unaware of permission for China survey ship in Philippine EEZ
item.description: Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. does not know of any permission for a Chinese survey vessel in the Philippines' Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ).

item.title: DOH: Pooled testing won't be efficient in areas with high prevalence of COVID-19
item.description: "Hindi siya magiging efficient kapag ang gagamitan natin ng pooled testing ay areas na mataas ang prevalence--ibig sabihin maraming kaso, maraming clusters. Hindi natin 'yan puwedeng gamitin kasi made-defeat ang purpose ng ating pooled testing," Health Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire said.

item.title: Nearby regions ready to respond in case NCR hospitals reach full capacity --DOH
item.description: "Kung tayo man ay mapupuno dito sa Metro Manila, nakahanda na ang mga karatig na regions natin to accommodate our patients," Health Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire said.

item.title: Duterte wants task force to probe PhilHealth anomalies
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte has ordered the creation of an inter-agency task force to probe the allegations of anomalies in the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth), Malacañang said Friday.

item.title: DOTr Asec. Libiran tests positive for COVID-19
item.description: Transportation Assistant Secretary Goddes Hope Libiran on Friday said she was tested positive for COVID-19.

item.title: Año says Philippines focusing on doing what s proper and practical
item.description: Interior Secretary Eduardo Año on Friday said the Philippine government has been focusing on what is appropriate and proper in combating COVID-19 pandemic than comparing itself to other countries.

item.title: Indigenous peoples' groups ask Supreme Court to junk anti-terror law
item.description: Indigenous peoples' groups have asked the Supreme Court to declare the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 null and void, alleging that the law violates their right to self-determination.

item.title: IATF approves measures to ensure delivery of cash aid during MECQ
item.description: The Philippines COVID-19 task force has adopted measures to ensure the delivery of cash assistance to low-income households while Metro Manila and its nearby provinces are under a stricter lockdown.

item.title: DOH: Non-isolation of persons exposed to COVID-19 individuals could contribute to community transmission
item.description: “We have observed na ang mga pasyente o mga symptomatic naa-isolate, yung mga exposed na individuals hindi po masyadong naa-isolate baka nga ito ang nakapag-contribute, isa sa factor for community transmission,” Health Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire said in an Unang Hirit interview.

item.title: Many small private hospitals applied but did not receive IRM from PhilHealth -- PHAPI exec
item.description: Several private hospitals are left wondering why they have not been prioritized by PhilHealth in the Interim Reimbursement Mechanism which could have helped them better respond to the COVID-19 pandemic, an official of the Private Hospitals Association of the Philippines Inc. (PHAPI) said Friday.

item.title: Angkas deploys riders to give rides to health workers, donates motorcycle barriers
item.description: At least 1,000 riders from ride-hailing firm Angkas will provide transportation services to medical frontliners amid the limited public transportion under modified enhanced community quarantine (MECQ).

item.title: DILG chief Año confident COVID-19 cases to decrease amid MECQ
item.description: Interior Secretary Eduardo Año on Friday expressed confidence that the number of COVID-19 infections would decrease during the enforcement of the modified enhanced community quarantine in some areas, including Metro Manila.

item.title: BI: No additional restrictions on international travel under MECQ
item.description: The Bureau of Immigration (BI) on Friday said there are no additional restrictions on international travel even though stricter quarantine measures were reimposed in Metro Manila and other nearby areas.
